notes.text:
This update for squid fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2016-4051: backport fix buffer overflow in cachemgr.cgi (bsc#976553)
- CVE-2016-4554: backport fix for header smuggling issue in HTTP Request processing (bsc#979010)
notes.title: Description of the patch

notes.text: CSAF 2.0 data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
notes.title: Terms of use

notes.text: Buffer overflow in cachemgr.cgi in Squid 2.x, 3.x before 3.5.17, and 4.x before 4.0.9 might allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service or execute arbitrary code by seeding manager reports with crafted data.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: mime_header.cc in Squid before 3.5.18 allows remote attackers to bypass intended same-origin restrictions and possibly conduct cache-poisoning attacks via a crafted HTTP Host header, aka a "header smuggling" issue.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
